Name: Hirak Exchange Rates
Description: Exchange rates between 162 currency & 300 crypto currency update each 5 min, accurate, no limits

Retrieve the exchange rate between two currencies, with the option to specify a date range for historical data.
Parameters: {"baseCurrency": "Required. string. The base currency code.", "targetCurrency": "Required. string. The target currency code.", "startDate": "string. The start date for historical data in YYYY-MM-DD format.", "endDate": "string. The end date for historical data in YYYY-MM-DD format."}

Retrieve exchange rates for all supported currencies and cryptocurrencies.

Parameters: {"baseCurrency": "string.", "targetCurrency": "string.", "amount": "number."}

Demonstration.Instruction: I'm curious about how the value of the Indian Rupee has changed against the US dollar over the past year. Can you provide me with the exchange rates between these two currencies for each month in the past 12 months (from 2020-01-01 to 2020-12-31)?

I'm planning a trip to Europe and want to know the exchange rates for all the major European currencies against the US dollar. Can you provide me with this information?

Query.Instruction: I'm thinking about exchanging some of my Canadian dollars for Euros. Can you tell me the current exchange rate and how much 1000 CAD would be in EUR?

Name: Kraken
Description: Cryptocurrencies Exchange

Retrieve real-time market data for a specific cryptocurrency pair.

Function_Description.getHistoricalData:
Retrieve historical market data for a specific cryptocurrency pair and time range.

The start time of the data range in ISO 8601 format.", "end": "string. The end time of the data range in ISO 8601 format."}
Function_Description.placeOrder:
Place a new order for a specific cryptocurrency pair.

Function_Description.getOrderStatus:
Retrieve the status of a specific order.

Function_Description.cancelOrder:
Cancel a specific order.
Parameters: {"txid": "string. The ID of the order to cancel."}
Function_Description.getAccountBalances:
Retrieve the account balances for all cryptocurrencies.
Parameters: {}
Function_Description.getTransactionHistory:
Retrieve the transaction history for a specific cryptocurrency.
Parameters: {"currency": "string. The currency code of the cryptocurrency to retrieve the transaction history for.", "start": "string. The start time of the data range in ISO 8601 format.", "end": "string. The end time of the data range in ISO 8601 format.", "limit": "integer. The maximum number of transactions to return."}

Name: REST Countries
Description: Get information about countries via a RESTful API

Function_Description.getCountryDetails:
Retrieve basic information on a specific country, including its name, capital, flag, and population.

Name: EVA

Name: AviationAPI
Description: FAA Aeronautical Charts and Publications, Airport Information, and Airport Weather

Function_Description.airports_get:
Get an airport by its ICAO or FAA identifier
Parameters: {"apt": "Required. string. FAA or ICAO facility identifier (KAVL or AVL). Separate multiple entries with a comma."}
Function_Description.charts_get:
Get charts for a specified airport
Parameters: {"apt": "Required. string. FAA or ICAO airport identifier (KAVL or AVL). Separate multiple entries with a comma.", "group": "integer. Optional grouping of the charts. 1 -> General, Departures, Arrivals, Approaches; 2 -> Airport Diagram only; 3 -> General only; 4 -> Departures only; 5 -> Arrivals only; 6 -> Approaches only; 7 -> Everything but General."}
Function_Description.charts_changes_get:
Get chart changes by airport or chart name
Parameters: {"apt": "Required. string. FAA or ICAO airport identifier (KAVL or AVL).", "chart_name": "string. Partial or full name of the chart/procedure."}
Function_Description.charts_afd_get:
Get the AFD for a specified airport
Parameters: {"apt": "Required. string. FAA or ICAO airport identifier (KCLT or CLT)."}
Function_Description.preferred-routes_get:
Get all of the preferred routes
Parameters: {}

Demonstration.Instruction: I'm preparing for a flight to Asheville Regional Airport (ICAO: AVL). Can you get me the aeronautical charts for this airport? I would like to see the general, departures, arrivals, and approaches charts specifically.
I'm planning a trip to Asheville, North Carolina and I'd like to know more about the Asheville Regional Airport. Can you find the details for me using its FAA identifier, AVL?

I'm a travel blogger and I'm writing about the airports in New York. Can you provide me with the airport information for John F. Kennedy International Airport (ICAO: KJFK) and LaGuardia Airport (ICAO: KLGA)?

Name: TIPO
Description: Taiwan patent search system

Function_Description.searchPatents:
Search for patents based on various criteria, including patent number, title, and assignee name.
Parameters: {"patentNumber": "string. Optional. Patent number to search for.", "title": "string. Optional. Title of the patent to search for.", "assigneeName": "string. Optional. Name of the assignee to search for.", "limit": "integer. Optional. Maximum number of results to return.", "offset": "integer. Optional. Offset for pagination."}
Function_Description.getPatentDetails:
Retrieve detailed information about a specific patent, including abstract, application date, and inventors' names.
Parameters: {"patentNumber": "string. Required. Patent number to retrieve details for."}
Function_Description.searchPatentsByClassification:
Search for patents based on the International Patent Classification (IPC) and US Patent Classification (USPC).
Parameters: {"ipc": "string. Optional. International Patent Classification code to search for.", "uspc": "string. Optional. US Patent Classification code to search for.", "limit": "integer. Optional. Maximum number of results to return.", "offset": "integer. Optional. Offset for pagination."}
Function_Description.getPatentFamily:
Retrieve information about related patents, such as US continuation patents, European divisional patents, and PCT applications.
Parameters: {"patentNumber": "string. Required. Patent number to retrieve family information for."}

Demonstration.Instruction: We are working on a new invention in the field of autonomous drones. Can you help me find the latest 10 patents assigned to "SkyTech Industries" with the titles containing "autonomous drone"?

My coworker mentioned a patent from our company with the number TW202100345. You need to verify the existence of the patent first. I'd like to know if we have any related patents in the patent family for this one. Can you please give me a list of those patents and their relationship types?

I'm working on a project related to electric vehicles, and I need to find some patents for reference. Can you please search patents with the title containing "electric vehicle" and show me the top 10 results?

Query.Instruction: We need to understand the patent landscape around 3D printing technology. Please find patents under the US Patent Classification code "B29C64" and give me a list of the first 15 titles and their assignee names.

Name: Open Science Framework
Description: Repository and archive for study designs, research materials, data, manuscripts, etc

Function_Description.createProject:
Create a new research project.
Parameters: {"title": "Required. string. The title of the project.", "description": "string. A brief description of the project.", "category": "string. One of: [data, software, hypothesis]. The category of the project (e.g., 'data', 'software', 'hypothesis')."}
Function_Description.addContributor:
Add a contributor to an existing project.

Function_Description.searchProjects:

Function_Description.getUserDetails:

The start time of the data range in ISO 8601 format.", "end": "string. The end time of the data range in ISO 8601 format.", "limit": "integer. The maximum number of transactions to return."}

Name: Postman Echo

Function_Description.getEcho:

Function_Description.putEcho:

Function_Description.deleteEcho:
Sends a DELETE request to the specified endpoint and receives response data.
Parameters: {"endpoint": "Required. string. The endpoint to send the DELETE request to.", "queryParams": "Object.  Key-value pairs of query parameters to include in the request."}
Function_Description.patchEcho:
Sends a PATCH request to the specified endpoint with the provided data and receives response data.
Parameters: {"endpoint": "Required. string. The endpoint to send the PATCH request to.", "headers": "Object.  Key-value pairs of headers to include in the request."}

Retrieves a list of available endpoints for testing with Postman Echo.

Function_Description.getRandomName:
Returns a random Spanish name with gender information
Parameters: {"gender": "string. One of: [male, female]. Optional. String. 'male' or 'female'. If not provided, a random gender will be selected."}
Function_Description.getRandomNames:
Returns a list of random Spanish names with gender information
Parameters: {"count": "integer. Optional. Integer. The number of names to return.", "gender": "string. One of: [male, female]. Optional. String. 'male' or 'female'. If not provided, a random gender will be selected.", "length": "string. One of: [short, medium, long]. Optional. String. 'short', 'medium', or 'long'. If provided, names will be filtered by length.", "startsWith": "string. Optional. String. If provided, names will be filtered to only include those that start with the given string."}
Function_Description.getRandomNameByCountry:
Returns a random Spanish name with gender information from a specific country
Parameters: {"country": "string. Required. String. The name of the country to retrieve a name from."}
Function_Description.getAllNames:
Returns a JSON object with all available Spanish names
Parameters: {}

Demonstration.Instruction: Give me a list of 20 Spanish names with gender information, filtered by length (short).
Can you provide me with a list of all available Spanish names?
Please give me a random Spanish name with gender information for a female.

Query.Instruction: I need a Spanish name from Argentina. Can you give me one?

Name: ApiFlash
Description: screenshot for developers based on Chrome

Function_Description.captureScreenshot:
Captures a full-page screenshot of a web page.
Parameters: {"url": "Required. string. The URL of the web page to capture.", "format": "string. The format of the screenshot. Can be 'png' or 'jpeg'. One of: [png, jpeg].", "quality": "integer. The quality of the screenshot. Only applicable if format is 'jpeg'."}
Function_Description.captureScreenshotElement:
Captures a custom sized screenshot of a specific element on a web page.
Parameters: {"url": "Required. string. The URL of the web page to capture.", "selector": "Required. string. The CSS selector of the element to capture.", "format": "string. The format of the screenshot. Can be 'png' or 'jpeg'. One of: [png, jpeg].", "quality": "integer. The quality of the screenshot. Only applicable if format is 'jpeg'."}
Function_Description.addEffect:
Adds an effect to a screenshot.
Parameters: {"screenshot": "Required. string. The base64-encoded string of the screenshot.", "effect": "Required. string. The effect to apply to the screenshot. Can be 'blur' or 'grayscale'. One of: [blur, grayscale]."}
Function_Description.getScreenshotInfo:
Retrieves information about a screenshot, such as its size and format.
Parameters: {"screenshot": "Required. string. The base64-encoded string of the screenshot."}
Function_Description.listScreenshotFormats:
Retrieves a list of supported screenshot formats.
Parameters: {}

Demonstration.Instruction: I want to add a blur effect to a screenshot. Can you guide me through it? I have the base64-encoded string of the screenshot(ajhdi21o34h4g35k2k2897c9ad2q==) with me.
I want to know what screenshot formats are supported by the API. Can you help me with that?

The type of sensor data to retrieve (e.g., air quality, traffic, weather).", "startTime": "Required. string. The start time of the time range in ISO 8601 format.", "endTime": "Required. string. The end time of the time range in ISO 8601 format."}
Function_Description.getSensorLocations:
Retrieve a list of available sensor locations.
Parameters: {}
Function_Description.getSensorTypes:
Retrieve a list of available sensor types.
Parameters: {}
Function_Description.getVisualizations:

Name: Square
Description: Easy way to take payments, manage refunds, and help customers checkout online

Function_Description.processPayment:
Process a payment online, in-person, or on-the-go.
Parameters: {"amount": "Required. integer. The amount to be charged in the smallest currency unit (e.g., cents for USD).", "currency": "Required. string. The currency code of the payment.", "sourceId": "Required. string. The unique identifier of the payment source (e.g., card, bank account).", "locationId": "Required. string. The unique identifier of the location where the payment is being processed.", "note": "string. A note to attach to the payment for reference."}
Function_Description.issueRefund:
Issue a refund for a specific payment.
Parameters: {"paymentId": "Required. string. The unique identifier of the payment to be refunded.", "amount": "Required. integer. The amount to be refunded in the smallest currency unit (e.g., cents for USD).", "currency": "Required. string. The currency code of the refund.", "reason": "string. The reason for the refund."}
Function_Description.listTransactions:
Retrieve a list of transactions for a specific location and date range.
Parameters: {"locationId": "Required. string. The unique identifier of the location to retrieve transactions for.", "startDate": "Required. string. The start date for the date range in YYYY-MM-DD format.", "endDate": "Required. string. The end date for the date range in YYYY-MM-DD format.", "limit": "integer. The maximum number of transactions to return (e.g. 50).", "cursor": "string. A pagination cursor to retrieve the next set of results."}
Function_Description.createCheckout:
Create a custom checkout experience for a specific location.
Parameters: {"locationId": "Required. string. The unique identifier of the location to create the checkout for.", "amount": "Required. integer. The amount to be charged in the smallest currency unit (e.g., cents for USD).", "currency": "Required. string. The currency code of the payment.", "referenceId": "string. A unique identifier to associate with the checkout for reference.", "note": "string. A note to attach to the checkout for reference."}

Demonstration.Instruction: My friend wants to pay me $50 for the concert tickets I bought for us. She gave me her card details, which have a unique identifier of "card321". Process the payment in USD and use the location ID "loc111". Add a note mentioning "Concert Tickets Payment".

I just sold a painting for $500, and the buyer wants to pay with their credit card. Can you help me process the payment? The currency is USD, and the location ID is "loc123". The card's unique identifier is "card789". Also, add a note saying "Painting Sale".
I need to issue a refund of $25 to a customer who returned a damaged product. The payment ID is "pay890", and the currency is USD. Please include the reason for the refund as "Damaged Product".

Query.Instruction: I'm hosting a charity event, and I want to create a custom checkout experience for donations. The location ID is "loc789", and the suggested donation amount is $20 in USD. Add a reference ID as "CharityEvent" and a note saying "Thank you for your support!".

Name: FullHunt

Parameters: {"domainOrIP": "Required. string. The domain or IP address to search for."}

The syntax highlighting format.", "access": "string. One of: [public, unlisted, private]. The access level of the paste (public, unlisted, or private).", "expireDate": "string. The expiration date of the paste (e.g., 10M for 10 minutes, 1H for 1 hour, etc.)."}

Calculate the optimal route between two or more locations in Singapore.

The type of route to calculate (e.g., 'walk', 'drive', 'cycle').", "avoidERP": "boolean. Whether to avoid Electronic Road Pricing (ERP) gantries.", "dateTime": "string. Performs a DNS lookup for a given domain name and returns its IP address.

Performs a reverse DNS lookup for a given IP address and returns its domain name.

Converts a binary number to its decimal equivalent.

Function_Description.decimalToBinary:
Converts a decimal number to its binary equivalent.
Parameters: {"decimalNumber": "Required. integer. The decimal number to convert to binary."}
Function_Description.generateHash:
Generates a hash for a given input string using the specified hashing algorithm.
Parameters: {"inputString": "Required. string. The input string to generate hash for.", "algorithm": "Required. string. The hashing algorithm to use (e.g., 'md5', 'sha1', 'sha256'). One of: [md5, sha1, sha256]."}
Function_Description.generatePassword:
Generates a random password with the specified length and character set.
Parameters: {"length": "Required. integer. The length of the generated password.", "characterSet": "string. The character set to use for generating the password (e.g., 'alphanumeric', 'numeric', 'special'). One of: [alphanumeric, numeric, special]."}
Function_Description.validatePassword:
Validates a given password against a set of rules, such as minimum length, character set, and complexity.
Parameters: {"password": "Required. string. The password to validate.", "rules": "Object{minLength: integer. The minimum length of the password., characterSet: string. The allowed character set of the password (e.g., 'alphanumeric', 'numeric', 'special')., complexity: string. The required complexity of the password (e.g., 'low', 'medium', 'high').}. A set of rules to validate the password against (e.g., {'minLength': 8, 'characterSet': 'alphanumeric', 'complexity': 'medium'})."}

One of: [AC, AL, AM, AP, BA, CE, DF, ES, GO, MA, MG, MS, MT, PA, PB, PE, PI, PR, RJ, RN, RO, RR, RS, SC, SE, SP, TO]. The state abbreviation."}

Recently, I heard of a landing site with ID "LP123789" near an attraction I am interested in visiting. Could you provide me the top 3 reviews to help me decide if it's a good option?

Name: LectServe

Retrieves the current liturgical calendar with important dates and events highlighted.

Function_Description.searchEvents:
Searches for key liturgical events by date or keyword.

Customizes the calendar to fit the needs of your specific organization.

The end date of the customized calendar in the format 'YYYY-MM-DD'.", "eventTypes": "Required. Array[string]. Specifies which types of events to include in the customized calendar. Can you customize a calendar for me that only includes holy days and feast days from May 1st to May 31st, 2020?
Please search for all the events that are happening on the same day as my birthday(2002-01-01).

Name: Metabase
Description: An open source Business Intelligence server to share data and analytics inside your company

Function_Description.executeSqlQuery:
Execute an SQL query and retrieve the results programmatically.
Parameters: {"query": "Required. string. The SQL query to be executed.", "databaseId": "Required. integer. The ID of the database to run the query on."}
Function_Description.updateSettings:
Update Metabase settings and preferences.
Parameters: {"settingKey": "Required. string. The key of the setting to be updated.", "settingValue": "Required. string. The new value for the setting."}
Function_Description.createCollection:
Create a new collection of items like dashboards, questions, and snippets.
Parameters: {"name": "Required. string. The name of the new collection.", "description": "string. A brief description of the collection."}
Function_Description.listCollections:
Retrieve a list of all collections.
Parameters: {"search": "string. A search term to filter collections by name or description.", "page": "integer. The page number for pagination. ", "perPage": "integer. The number of collections to display per page. "}
Function_Description.addUser:
Add a new user to Metabase.
Parameters: {"email": "Required. string. The email address of the new user.", "password": "Required. string. The password for the new user.", "firstName": "Required. string. The first name of the new user.", "lastName": "Required. string. The last name of the new user.", "groupId": "integer. The ID of the group to add the user to."}
Function_Description.listUsers:
Retrieve a list of all users.
Parameters: {"search": "string. A search term to filter users by email, first name, or last name.", "page": "integer. The page number for pagination. ", "perPage": "integer. The number of users to display per page. "}
Function_Description.updatePermissions:
Update permissions and access levels for a user or group.
Parameters: {"userId": "integer. The ID of the user to update permissions for.", "groupId": "integer. The ID of the group to update permissions for.", "permissions": "Required. Object. A JSON object containing the new permissions and access levels. For example, "collections": {"read": true, "write": true}"}

Demonstration.Instruction: We've just hired a new data analyst named Susan Meyers. Her email address is susan.meyers@example.com, and she'll be using the temporary password "S_29ifjsl!t". Can you add her to our Metabase system and assign her to the group with ID 3?
I want to have an idea of how many users are in our BI department. Please search for all users whose email addresses contain "bi@example.com" and list them for me.
I find the default number of rows displayed in the result table a bit too small. Change the settings to display 50 rows per page instead. Use the "rows_per_page" setting key and a new value of "50."

Query.Instruction: I'd like to organize some important reports related to our sales data. Create a new collection named "Sales Reports" and add a description: "A collection of sales-related dashboards, questions, and snippets."

Answer.Action_Input: {"name": "Sales Reports", "description": "A collection of sales-related dashboards, questions, and snippets."}

The new status of the task.", "tags": "Array[string].  The new tags associated with the task.", "custom_fields": "Object.  The new custom fields and their values for the task."}
